intro: Tetrandra wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Tetrandra wallichii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
